name: Of Monsters and Men
description:
'''Of Monsters and Men''' is an English-language Icelandic [[indie folk]]/[[Folk rock|rock]] band formed in [[Garðabær]] in 2010. It consists of lead singer and guitarist [[Nanna Bryndís Hilmarsdóttir]], singer and guitarist [[Ragnar Þórhallsson|Ragnar "Raggi" Þórhallsson]], lead guitarist [[Brynjar Leifsson]], drummer Arnar Rósenkranz Hilmarsson, and bassist Kristján Páll Kristjánsson.

The band has released four studio albums: ''[[My Head Is an Animal]]'' (2011), ''[[Beneath the Skin (Of Monsters and Men album)|Beneath the Skin]]'' (2015), ''[[Fever Dream (Of Monsters and Men album)|Fever Dream]]'' (2019), and ''[[All Is Love and Pain in the Mouse Parade]]'' (2025). They achieved commercial success with their 2011 single "[[Little Talks]]", which reached the top 10 of the charts in several countries and no. 20 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]].

Of Monsters and Men won the [[Músíktilraunir]] in 2010, an annual [[Battle of the Bands]] in Iceland. They also won the 2013 [[European Border Breakers Awards]].
